what: Derivatives for the queuing model \(M/M/\infty\) — dMoIda
title: Derivatives for the queuing model \(M/M/\infty\) — dMoIda
text: queuing model \(M/M/\infty\) tracks MoI cohort humans ages. assumes time- age-dependent hazard rate infection, called force infection (FoI, \(h_\tau()\)). Infections affect , one clears independently rate \(r\). Let \(\zeta_i\) fraction population MoI = , $$\frac{d\zeta_0}{da}= -h_\tau() \zeta_0 + r \zeta_1$$ \(\geq 1\) $$\frac{d\zeta_i}{da}= h_\tau() \left( \zeta_{-1} - \zeta_i \right)  - ri \zeta_i + r(+1)\zeta_{+1}$$ function computes derivatives form can used [deSolve::ode].
